itemRef.headline: Japan's nuclear power plant accident not catastrophic
itemRef.description: Russian nuclear industry experts are hoping that their Japanese colleagues will manage to take the situation on the nuclear power plant Fukushima under control, Sergei Boyarkin, programs director at Rosatom, told reporters on Tuesday.

contentMeta.headline: Apple's Steve Jobs takes medical leave

itemRef.headline: Apple's Steve Jobs takes medical leave
itemRef.description: Apple Inc's <AAPL.O> Steve Jobs said the board has granted him medical leave to concentrate on his health. Apple stock fell as much as 7 percent on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange following the news.

itemRef.headline: Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveils the company's latest high-end ultra-thin MacBook Air laptop models during a news conference at Apple Inc. headquarters in Cupertino
itemRef.description: Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveils the company's latest high-end ultra-thin MacBook Air laptop models during a news conference at Apple Inc. headquarters in Cupertino, California, October 20, 2010. REUTERS/Norbert von der Groeben (UNITED STATES - Tags: SCI TECH BUSINESS)

itemRef.headline: Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveils the latest Mac operating system software named "Lion" during a news conference at Apple Inc. headquarters in Cupertino
itemRef.description: Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveils the latest Mac operating system software named "Lion" during a news conference at Apple Inc. headquarters in Cupertino, California, October 20, 2010. The company is expected to tout a new version of its high-end ultra-thin MacBook Air laptop, sporting a smaller screen and better battery life. REUTERS/Norbert von der Groeben (UNITED STATES - Tags: SCI TECH BUSINESS IMAGES OF THE DAY)

itemRef.headline: Strategy Analytics: Apple Takes Lion's Share of Smartphone Revenue in 2010
itemRef.description: While Apple trailed Nokia in 2010 smartphone volume, Apple dominated the market in revenue, and took 29 percent share of the market value. The top 3 players-Apple, Nokia and RIM-generated 64 percent of the revenue in the smartphone market, as reported in, "Smartphone Revenues Hit $99 Billion in 2010 and Apple Takes Lion's Share of 29 Percent," from Strategy Analytics.

itemRef.headline: Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveils the latest Mac operating system software named "Lion" during a news conference at Apple Inc. headquarters in Cupertino
BRIEF-Apple releases developer preview of Mac OS X Lion

contentMeta.headline: UK spending cuts to rely on will and luck

itemRef.headline: UK spending cuts to rely on will and luck
itemRef.description: Britain's toughest public spending cuts in living memory will be achieved only with a mix of unprecedented political will and a dollop of economic good luck.

itemRef.headline: Prime Minister David Cameron leaves after attending a meeting at number 10 Downing Street in London
itemRef.description: Prime Minister David Cameron leaves after attending a cabinet meeting at number 10 Downing Street, March 23, 2011. REUTERS/Stefan Wermuth

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: Credit Suisse CEO pay down 34 pct in 2010

itemRef.headline: Credit Suisse CEO pay down 34 pct in 2010
itemRef.description: Credit Suisse chief Brady Dougan was paid 10.2 million Swiss francs in bonuses for 2010, the bank's annual report showed, putting his total earnings at four times those of rival UBS CEO Oswald Gruebel, who waived his bonus for the year.

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: WPP may relocate tax base back to UK

itemRef.headline: WPP may relocate tax base back to UK
itemRef.description: Advertising giant WPP <WPP.L> is likely to move its tax base back to the UK from Ireland following changes to taxation proposed in Wednesday's budget.

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: Imperial sees pain in Spain as growth slows

itemRef.headline: Imperial sees pain in Spain as growth slows
itemRef.description: Imperial Tobacco <IMT.L>, the world's fourth-biggest cigarette maker, saw a slowdown in sales growth in the first three months of 2011 due to a tough market in Spain and a shift in trade buying patterns in Britain.

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: Kingfisher to step up expansion in tough market

itemRef.headline: Kingfisher to step up expansion in tough market
itemRef.description: Kingfisher <KGF.L>, Europe's biggest home improvement retailer, plans to step up its expansion as well as measures to boost profit margins, as it battles tough trading conditions in many markets.

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: Lactalis, Ferrero to team up over Parmalat-paper

itemRef.headline: Lactalis, Ferrero to team up over Parmalat-paper
itemRef.description: Italy's top food group Ferrero and France's dairy group Lactalis may end up joining forces for control of Italian dairy company Parmalat <PLT.MI> at the centre of a tussle between potential Italian buyers and Lactalis, Les Echos newspaper said on Thursday.
itemRef.by: Reporting by Dominique Vidalon; Additional reporting bu Ian Simpson in Milan; Editing by Hans Peters

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: EU prepares to help banks amid worries on Ireland

itemRef.headline: EU prepares to help banks amid worries on Ireland
itemRef.description: European Union leaders will agree this week to prepare to recapitalise banks that fail upcoming stress tests, according to a draft statement obtained by Reuters on Wednesday.

rightsInfo.copyrightNotice: (c) Copyright Thomson Reuters 2011. Click For Restrictions - http://about.reuters.com/fulllegal.asp

contentMeta.headline: Rio:no material impact on Japan iron ore shipments

itemRef.headline: Rio:no material impact on Japan iron ore shipments
itemRef.description: Global miner Rio Tinto <RIO.AX> <RIO.L> said the jury was still out on whether the current system of quarterly iron ore pricing would stay as more producers moved to shorter-term arrangements to reflect wild swings in spot prices.
